channel.title: Sources for a Good Amount of Programming Languages
channel.description:
Hey guys! Here's a list of around 60+ sources I've gotten together for 10 programming languages. These sources will help you, so I recommend you check 'em out! If the link does not work please copy paste the address into your browser.
SOURCES:
HTML5
- http://www.w3schools.com/html/html5_intro.asp
- http://www.jesusda.com/docs/ebooks/ebook_manual_en_dive-into-html5.pdf
- http://www.codeproject.com/Articles/751927/Beginners-Guide-to-HTML-and-CSS-Writing-Your-First
- http://html5doctor.com/article-archive/
- http://onlinevideolecture.com/ebooks/?subject=HTML5
- http://www.tutorialspoint.com/html5/html5_tutorial.pdf
- http://www.thecssninja.com/demo/gmail_dragout/html5-cheat-sheet.pdf
- http://www.tutorialspoint.com/html5/
- http://www.html-5-tutorial.com/
PYTHON
- http://www.tutorialspoint.com/python/
- https://www.codecademy.com/learn/python
- http://www.learnpython.org/ (You can learn other langs. On it too)
- https://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/A_Beginner%27s_Python_Tutorial
- http://sthurlow.com/python/
- https://www.codementor.io/python/tutorial
- http://www.greenteapress.com/thinkpython/thinkpython.pdf
- http://tdc-www.harvard.edu/Python.pdf
- http://www.ucs.cam.ac.uk/docs/course-notes/unix-courses/PythonAB/files/handout.pdf
- http://www.fromdev.com/2014/03/python-tutorials-resources.html (MEGA LIST)
C
- http://www.cprogramming.com/tutorial/c-tutorial.html
- http://www.tutorialspoint.com/cprogramming/
- http://www.programiz.com/c-programming
- https://thenewboston.com/videos.php?cat=14
- http://www.learn-c.org/
- http://fresh2refresh.com/c-programming/
- http://www.w3schools.in/c/
- http://phy.ntnu.edu.tw/~cchen/ctutor.pdf
- http://www.tutorialspoint.com/cprogramming/cprogramming_tutorial.pdf
- https://hassanolity.files.wordpress.com/2013/11/the_c_programming_language_2.pdf
SQL
- http://www.w3schools.com/sql/
- http://www.sqlcourse.com/
- http://www.tutorialspoint.com/sql/
- https://www.codecademy.com/learn/learn-sql
- http://sqlzoo.net/
- http://www.sql-tutorial.net/
- http://www.firstsql.com/tutor.htm
- http://www.tutorialspoint.com/sql/sql_tutorial.pdf
- http://www.baskent.edu.tr/~tkaracay/etudio/ders/dbase/sql/pdfSQL/BasicSqlStatements.pdf
- https://www.stat.berkeley.edu/~spector/sql.pdf
- http://www.dis.uniroma1.it/derosa/didattica/2005/BasiDati/SQL_A_Practical_Introduction.pdf
- http://magnum.anu.edu.au/~TDFgg/Public/Release/Database/sql_intro.pdf
PHP
- http://www.w3schools.com/php/
- https://www.codecademy.com/learn/php
- http://www.tutorialspoint.com/php/
- http://php.net/manual/en/tutorial.php
- http://devzone.zend.com/6/php-101-php-for-the-absolute-beginner/
- http://www.webmonkey.com/2010/02/php_tutorial_for_beginners/
- http://www.homeandlearn.co.uk/php/php.html
- http://www.tizag.com/phpT/
- http://php.net/manual/en/book.pdf.php
- http://www.tutorialspoint.com/php/php_tutorial.pdf
JS(JavaScript)
- http://www.w3schools.com/js/
- http://www.tutorialspoint.com/javascript/
- https://www.codecademy.com/learn/javascript
- http://javascript.info/
- http://htmldog.com/guides/javascript/
- http://www.webteacher.com/javascript/
- http://www.webmonkey.com/2010/02/javascript_tutorial_-_lesson_1/
- http://cs.brown.edu/courses/bridge/1998/res/javascript/javascript-tutorial.html
- http://www.homeandlearn.co.uk/JS/javascript.html
- http://www.howtocreate.co.uk/tutorials/javascript/
- http://www.tutorialspoint.com/javascript/javascript_tutorial.pdf
- http://eloquentjavascript.net/Eloquent_JavaScript.pdf
- https://www.ohio.edu/technology/training/upload/Java-Script-Reference-Guide.pdf
JAVA -(Not many)
- http://www.tutorialspoint.com/java/
- http://javabeginnerstutorial.com/core-java/
- http://www.learnjavaonline.org/
- http://beginnersbook.com/java-tutorial-for-beginners-with-examples/
- https://iamgodsom.files.wordpress.com/2014/08/java-the-complete-reference-7th-edition.pdf
- http://www.oracle.com/events/global/en/java-outreach/resources/java-a-beginners-guide-1720064.pdf
- http://portal.aauj.edu/e_books/teach_your_self_java_in_21_days.pdf
- http://math.hws.edu/eck/cs124/downloads/javanotes6-linked.pdf
C#(C-Sharp)
- http://www.csharp-station.com/Tutorial.aspx
- https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/aa288436(v=vs.71).aspx
- http://www.tutorialspoint.com/csharp/
- http://csharp.net-tutorials.com/
- http://www.completecsharptutorial.com/
- http://www.learncs.org/
- https://channel9.msdn.com/Series/C-Sharp-Fundamentals-Development-for-Absolute-Beginners
- http://www.tutorialspoint.com/csharp/csharp_tutorial.pdf
- http://www.ssw.uni-linz.ac.at/Teaching/Lectures/CSharp/Tutorial/Part1.pdf
- http://www.introprogramming.info/wp-content/uploads/2013/07/Books/CSharpEn/Fundamentals-of-Computer-Programming-with-CSharp-Nakov-eBook-v2013.pd
C++
- http://www.cplusplus.com/doc/tutorial/
- http://www.tutorialspoint.com/cplusplus/
- http://www.cprogramming.com/tutorial/c++-tutorial.html
- http://www.learncpp.com/
- http://www.penguinprogrammer.co.uk/c-beginners-tutorial/introduction/
- http://www.sololearn.com/Course/CPlusPlus/
- http://www.cs.wustl.edu/~schmidt/C++/
- http://www.cplusplus.com/files/tutorial.pdf
- http://www.tutorialspoint.com/cplusplus/cpp_tutorial.pdf
- http://iacs-courses.seas.harvard.edu/courses/cs207/resources/TIC2Vone.pdf
ASSEMBLY
- http://www.tutorialspoint.com/assembly_programming/
- http://www.drpaulcarter.com/pcasm/
- http://showmedo.com/videotutorials/series?name=qdrYRTz8Z
- http://www.pravaraengg.org.in/Download/MA/assembly_tutorial.pdf
Side Note: If any of the links do not work, please try to copy paste them into your browser manually. If they still do not work please contact me so I can edit them out.

item.title: Sources for a Good Amount of Programming Languages
item.dc:creator: Maps
item.description:
After a FOIA request earlier this year NSA released a PDF documenting one of their Python training courses. I’ve found it to be very useful maybe others will too.

nsa.sfo2.digitaloceanspaces.com

comp3321.pdf

117.73 MB

Read full topic
item.source: Sources for a Good Amount of Programming Languages

item.title: Sources for a Good Amount of Programming Languages
item.dc:creator: dtm
item.description:
I’ve looked through his C tutorials and he clearly has no idea what he’s doing. Despite many, many people pointing out the flaws in his code, he has not fixed them (the last time that I checked) while students learn his mistakes. Now, just because he has no idea what he’s doing for one language doesn’t necessarily mean that it’s the same for all of the other languages (I know C has a bit more subtle intricacies than Python) but it certainly demonstrates his lack of care for providing incorrect information.

I’m not saying you should or shouldn’t watch his videos - you can learn however you wish. If I were to personally recommend anything, it would be from sources where the author is qualified to teach the material or at least has the credibility, i.e. textbooks, university courses, research papers/whitepapers, other people’s recommendations, etc. Of course, not everything can be learned though such ways, it’s not so black and white. But you should verify whatever you learn instead of taking it at face value. Would I recommend my own articles? Sure, but be skeptical of the information I provide.

tldr; based his C tutorials, I’m not confident in his ability to not teach incorrect information.

Read full topic
item.source: Sources for a Good Amount of Programming Languages

item.title: Sources for a Good Amount of Programming Languages
item.dc:creator: Sea
item.description:
Use whichever tutorials you find work best for your style of learning.

Looking back, I believe Bucky was not always the best at explaining content, but his videos are still okay for understanding syntax and giving you some use cases.

Read full topic

w3schools.in

Java Tutorials and Resources - W3schools

Learn how to program in Java. Learn the basic and advanced concepts of Java programming from this Java tutorial library, along with details and helpful examples.

item.title: Sources for a Good Amount of Programming Languages
item.dc:creator: Cromical
item.description:
Hey guys! Here’s a list of around 60+ sources I’ve gotten together for 10 programming languages. These sources will help you, so I recommend you check 'em out! If the link does not work please copy paste the address into your browser.

SOURCES:

HTML5

  • http://www.w3schools.com/html/html5_intro.asp

  • http://www.jesusda.com/docs/ebooks/ebook_manual_en_dive-into-html5.pdf

  • http://www.codeproject.com/Articles/751927/Beginners-Guide-to-HTML-and-CSS-Writing-Your-First

  • http://html5doctor.com/article-archive/

  • http://onlinevideolecture.com/ebooks/?subject=HTML5

  • http://www.tutorialspoint.com/html5/html5_tutorial.pdf

  • http://www.thecssninja.com/demo/gmail_dragout/html5-cheat-sheet.pdf

  • http://www.tutorialspoint.com/html5/

  • http://www.html-5-tutorial.com/

PYTHON

  • http://www.tutorialspoint.com/python/

  • https://www.codecademy.com/learn/python

  • http://www.learnpython.org/ (You can learn other langs. On it too)

  • https://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/A_Beginner's_Python_Tutorial

  • http://sthurlow.com/python/

  • https://www.codementor.io/python/tutorial

  • http://www.greenteapress.com/thinkpython/thinkpython.pdf

  • http://tdc-www.harvard.edu/Python.pdf

  • http://www.ucs.cam.ac.uk/docs/course-notes/unix-courses/PythonAB/files/handout.pdf

  • http://www.fromdev.com/2014/03/python-tutorials-resources.html (MEGA LIST)

C

  • http://www.cprogramming.com/tutorial/c-tutorial.html

  • http://www.tutorialspoint.com/cprogramming/

  • http://www.programiz.com/c-programming

  • https://thenewboston.com/videos.php?cat=14

  • http://www.learn-c.org/

  • http://fresh2refresh.com/c-programming/

  • http://www.w3schools.in/c/

  • http://phy.ntnu.edu.tw/~cchen/ctutor.pdf

  • http://www.tutorialspoint.com/cprogramming/cprogramming_tutorial.pdf

  • https://hassanolity.files.wordpress.com/2013/11/the_c_programming_language_2.pdf

SQL

  • http://www.w3schools.com/sql/

  • http://www.sqlcourse.com/

  • http://www.tutorialspoint.com/sql/

  • https://www.codecademy.com/learn/learn-sql
